context_bundle.summary: Playwright is modern browser automation framework with auto-wait, network interception, multi-browser support (Chromium, Firefox, WebKit), and built-in test runner with parallel execution and video recording.

onboarding.quick_start: Playwright workflow: 1) Launch browser with playwright.chromium.launch(). 2) Create page with browser.new_page(). 3) Navigate with page.goto(). 4) Interact using auto-waiting selectors. 5) Capture screenshots/videos. 6) Intercept network requests. 7) Run tests in parallel with pytest-playwright. Auto-waits eliminate flaky tests.
common_patterns: Basic setup: from playwright.sync_api import sync_playwright; with sync_playwright() as p: browser = p.chromium.launch(headless=False); page = browser.new_page(); page.goto('https://example.com')

Auto-wait interaction: page.click('button#submit'); page.fill('input#username', 'user@example.com'); page.select_option('select#country', 'US'); page.check('input#terms'); text = page.inner_text('.result')
Network interception: page.route('**/api/data', lambda route: route.fulfill(status=200, body='{"data": "mocked"}'); page.goto('https://example.com')

Test with pytest: import pytest; from playwright.sync_api import Page; @pytest.mark.playwright; def test_login(page: Page): page.goto('https://example.com/login'); page.fill('#username', 'user'); page.fill('#password', 'pass'); page.click('#submit'); assert page.inner_text('.welcome') == 'Welcome!'
